description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国开国元勋。辛亥革命时期，与孙中山常被时人以“孙黄”并称。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary and a founding father of the Republic of China. During the Xinhai Revolution, he was often referred to as 'Sun-Huang' along with Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国开国元勋，中国同盟会及中国国民党创始人。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary, a founding father of the Republic of China, and the founder of the Tongmenghui and the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴的第一任妻子。
description.en: The first wife of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴的革命同志及第二任妻子。
description.en: A revolutionary comrade and the second wife of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴的父亲，晚清秀才。
description.en: Father of Huang Xing, a scholar-official of the late Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清末由张之洞在武昌创办的新式学堂。
description.en: A new-style academy founded by Zhang Zhidong in Wuchang during the late Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清末为中国留学生在日本东京设立的预备学校。
description.en: A preparatory school for Chinese students in Tokyo, Japan, during the late Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 晚清名臣、洋务派代表人物，曾任湖广总督。
description.en: A prominent official in the late Qing Dynasty, a representative of the Self-Strengthening Movement, and former Viceroy of Huguang.

description.zh-cn: 由黄兴于1904年在湖南长沙创立的革命团体，以“驱逐鞑虏，复兴中华”为口号，后并入中国同盟会。
description.en: A revolutionary group founded by Huang Xing in Changsha, Hunan, in 1904, with the slogan 'Expel the Tartar barbarians and revive China.' It later merged into the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，华兴会、同盟会重要成员。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary and an important member of the Huaxinghui and Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代政治活动家、学者、律师，华兴会创始人之一。
description.en: A modern Chinese political activist, scholar, lawyer, and one of the founders of the Huaxinghui.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国开国元勋，华兴会创始人之一，国民党的主要筹建人。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary, a founding father of the Republic of China, one of the founders of the Huaxinghui, and a key figure in the establishment of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，华兴会创始人之一。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary and one of the founders of the Huaxinghui.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，国民党元老，华兴会创始人之一。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary, a veteran of the Kuomintang, and one of the founders of the Huaxinghui.

description.zh-cn: 华兴会策划的旨在慈禧太后七十寿辰之日于长沙发动的武装起义，因事机泄露而失败。
description.en: An armed uprising in Changsha planned by the Huaxinghui, intended to coincide with Empress Dowager Cixi's 70th birthday, which failed due to a leak.

description.zh-cn: 由兴中会、华兴会、光复会等多个革命团体于1905年在日本东京合并而成的全国性革命政党。
description.en: A national revolutionary political party formed in Tokyo, Japan, in 1905 by the merger of several revolutionary groups, including the Xingzhonghui, Huaxinghui, and Guangfuhui.

description.zh-cn: 1907年由孙中山、黄兴等同盟会成员在广西镇南关发动的旨在推翻清朝的武装起义。
description.en: An armed uprising launched in 1907 at Zhennanguan, Guangxi, by members of the Tongmenghui, including Sun Yat-sen and Huang Xing, aimed at overthrowing the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 1908年黄兴等人在广西钦州、廉州、上思地区发动的武装起义。
description.en: An armed uprising launched in 1908 by Huang Xing and others in the Qinzhou, Lianzhou, and Shangsi areas of Guangxi.

description.zh-cn: 1908年同盟会在云南河口发动的武装起义。
description.en: An armed uprising launched by the Tongmenghui in Hekou, Yunnan, in 1908.

zh-cn: 辛亥三月二十九广州一役

description.zh-cn: 1911年由中国同盟会在广州发起的一次武装起义，虽然失败，但极大地鼓舞了全国革命斗志。
description.en: An armed uprising launched by the Tongmenghui in Guangzhou in 1911. Although it failed, it greatly inspired the revolutionary spirit across the country.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，黄花岗起义总指挥。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary and the commander-in-chief of the Second Guangzhou Uprising (Huanghuagang Uprising).

description.zh-cn: 1911年10月10日爆发于武昌的武装起义，是辛亥革命的开端。
description.en: An armed uprising that broke out in Wuchang on October 10, 1911, marking the beginning of the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义后在湖北成立的革命政权。
description.en: The revolutionary government established in Hubei after the Wuchang Uprising.

en: Provisional Government of the Republic of China (1912)

description.zh-cn: 中华民国成立初期的临时中央政府。
description.en: The provisional central government during the early days of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的军事家、政治家，中华民国第一任正式大总统。
description.en: A military and political figure in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, and the first formal President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由中国同盟会及其他几个小党派于1912年改组而成的公开政党。
description.en: An open political party formed in 1912 through the reorganization of the Tongmenghui and several other minor parties.

description.zh-cn: 1913年孙中山和黄兴等国民党人为反对袁世凯独裁而发动的武装革命，最终失败。
description.en: An armed revolution launched in 1913 by Sun Yat-sen, Huang Xing, and other Kuomintang members to oppose Yuan Shikai's dictatorship, which ultimately failed.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初政治人物，曾任江苏都督。
description.en: A political figure in the late Qing and early Republican era, who served as the governor of Jiangsu.

description.zh-cn: 二次革命失败后，孙中山于1914年在日本东京创建的革命政党，是中国国民党的前身之一。
description.en: A revolutionary party founded by Sun Yat-sen in Tokyo, Japan, in 1914 after the failure of the Second Revolution. It was a predecessor to the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 为反对袁世凯称帝而发动的战争。
description.en: A war launched to oppose Yuan Shikai's attempt to proclaim himself emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的军事家、政治家，护国战争的主要组织者和领导者。
description.en: A military and political figure in the late Qing and early Republican era, and a key organizer and leader of the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任副总统和第二任、第四任大总统。
description.en: The first Vice President and the second and fourth President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1894年由孙中山在檀香山创立的中国第一个资产阶级革命团体，后并入中国同盟会。
description.en: China's first bourgeois revolutionary group, founded by Sun Yat-sen in Honolulu in 1894, which later merged into the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 清末由蔡元培、章太炎等人在上海成立的革命团体，后并入中国同盟会，但亦有成员退出。
description.en: A revolutionary group founded in Shanghai in the late Qing Dynasty by figures such as Cai Yuanpei and Zhang Taiyan. It later merged with the Tongmenghui, although some members subsequently withdrew.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初思想家、革命家、学者。
description.en: A thinker, revolutionary, and scholar of the late Qing and early Republican era.

description.zh-cn: 光复会领导人之一，革命家。
description.en: A revolutionary and one of the leaders of the Guangfuhui.

description.zh-cn: 近代民主革命家，青帮代表人物，同盟会元老。
description.en: A modern democratic revolutionary, a representative of the Green Gang, and a veteran of the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家。
description.en: A politician and military leader of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与廖淡如之长子。
description.en: Eldest son of Huang Xing and Liao Danru.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与廖淡如之次子。
description.en: Second son of Huang Xing and Liao Danru.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与廖淡如之五子，为遗腹子。
description.en: Fifth son of Huang Xing and Liao Danru, a posthumous child.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与廖淡如之长女。
description.en: Eldest daughter of Huang Xing and Liao Danru.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与廖淡如之次女。
description.en: Second daughter of Huang Xing and Liao Danru.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与廖淡如之三女。
description.en: Third daughter of Huang Xing and Liao Danru.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与徐宗汉之子。
description.en: Son of Huang Xing and Xu Zonghan.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与徐宗汉之子。
description.en: Son of Huang Xing and Xu Zonghan.

description.zh-cn: 清代湖南省长沙府下辖县，为黄兴出生地。
description.en: A county under Changsha Prefecture, Hunan Province during the Qing Dynasty, and the birthplace of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国江苏省下辖县，为黄兴逝世地。
description.en: A county under Jiangsu Province of the Republic of China, and the place where Huang Xing died.

description.zh-cn: 位于湖南省长沙市，黄兴的安葬地。
description.en: Located in Changsha, Hunan Province, the burial place of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 黄筱村是黄兴的父亲。
description.en: Huang Xiaocun is the father of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 廖淡如是黄兴的第一任妻子。
description.en: Liao Danru was the first wife of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 徐宗汉是黄兴的第二任妻子（二房）。
description.en: Xu Zonghan was the second wife of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 时任湖广总督的张之洞推荐黄兴入武昌两湖书院读书。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong, then Viceroy of Huguang, recommended Huang Xing to study at Lianghu Academy in Wuchang.

description.zh-cn: 与刘揆一、章士钊、宋教仁等人共同创立华兴会。
description.en: Co-founded the Huaxinghui with Liu Kuiyi, Zhang Shizhao, Song Jiaoren, and others.

description.zh-cn: 华兴会策划并试图发动长沙起义，但因事泄失败。
description.en: The Huaxinghui planned and attempted to launch the Changsha Uprising, but it failed due to a leak.

description.zh-cn: 将兴中会、华兴会、光复会等团体合并，成立中国同盟会。
description.en: Merged groups such as the Xingzhonghui, Huaxinghui, and Guangfuhui to establish the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 拥护孙中山将华兴会等团体合并，成立中国同盟会。
description.en: Supported Sun Yat-sen in merging groups like the Huaxinghui to establish the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 兴中会与华兴会等团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: The Xingzhonghui merged with the Huaxinghui and other groups to form the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 华兴会与兴中会等团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: The Huaxinghui merged with the Xingzhonghui and other groups to form the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 光复会与兴中会等团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: The Guangfuhui merged with the Xingzhonghui and other groups to form the Tongmenghui.

position.en: Chief of General Affairs, Executive Department

description.zh-cn: 在同盟会成立会上，提议公推孙中山为总理。
description.en: At the founding meeting of the Tongmenghui, proposed to elect Sun Yat-sen as Premier by public acclaim.

description.zh-cn: 与孙中山共同策划并发动了镇南关起义。
description.en: Jointly planned and launched the Zhennanguan Uprising with Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 率领部队在广西钦州、廉州、上思地区发动起义。
description.en: Led troops to launch an uprising in the Qinzhou, Lianzhou, and Shangsi areas of Guangxi.

description.zh-cn: 担任黄花岗起义副总指挥，并亲率敢死队进攻两广总督府。
description.en: Served as the deputy commander of the Huanghuagang Uprising and personally led the suicide squad to attack the Viceroy's office of Liangguang.

description.zh-cn: 担任黄花岗起义总指挥。
description.en: Served as the commander-in-chief of the Huanghuagang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 在黄花岗起义失败后，将受伤的黄兴护送至香港就医。
description.en: After the failure of the Huanghuagang Uprising, she escorted the wounded Huang Xing to Hong Kong for medical treatment.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义爆发后，黄兴被推举为中华民国军政府战时总司令。
description.en: After the Wuchang Uprising broke out, Huang Xing was elected as the wartime commander-in-chief of the Military Government of the Republic of China.

position.en: Minister of the Army and Chief of the General Staff

description.zh-cn: 在南京就任江苏讨袁军总司令，发动二次革命。
description.en: Assumed the post of Commander-in-Chief of the Jiangsu Punitive Army against Yuan in Nanjing, launching the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 发动二次革命武装讨伐袁世凯。
description.en: Launched the Second Revolution, an armed campaign against Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 强迫时任江苏都督程德全宣布独立，共同讨袁。
description.en: Forced Cheng Dequan, then Governor of Jiangsu, to declare independence and jointly oppose Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯的北洋军攻陷南京，导致二次革命失败。
description.en: Yuan Shikai's Beiyang Army captured Nanjing, leading to the failure of the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 二次革命失败后，在日本组织中华革命党。
description.en: After the failure of the Second Revolution, organized the Chinese Revolutionary Party in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 积极策动讨袁，派人促进云南护国军起义，并在美洲为护国军筹款。
description.en: Actively planned to oppose Yuan Shikai, sent people to promote the uprising of the Yunnan National Protection Army, and raised funds for it in the Americas.

description.zh-cn: 率领云南讨袁护国军，发动护国战争。
description.en: Led the Yunnan National Protection Army against Yuan Shikai, launching the National Protection War.

description.zh-cn: 护国战争旨在反对袁世凯称帝，最终迫使其取消帝制。
description.en: The National Protection War aimed to oppose Yuan Shikai's proclamation as emperor, ultimately forcing him to abandon the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 时任大总统黎元洪遵国会议决，颁令为黄兴举行国葬。
description.en: Then-President Li Yuanhong, following a resolution of the National Assembly, issued an order for a state funeral for Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 革命时期长期紧密合作，被时人以“孙黄”并称。虽在国旗方案等问题上有分歧，但黄兴最终以大局为重支持孙中山。孙中山在黄兴逝世后为其主丧。
description.en: They collaborated closely for a long time during the revolutionary period and were known as 'Sun-Huang.' Although they had disagreements on issues like the national flag design, Huang Xing ultimately supported Sun Yat-sen for the sake of the greater good. Sun Yat-sen presided over Huang Xing's funeral.

description.zh-cn: 因潮州起义失败等事，要求罢免孙中山同盟会总理职务，并起草《孙文罪状》发难。
description.en: Due to the failure of the Chaozhou Uprising and other matters, demanded the removal of Sun Yat-sen from his position as Premier of the Tongmenghui and drafted the 'Indictment of Sun Wen' to attack him.

description.zh-cn: 拒绝陶成章等人提出的取代孙中山任总理的要求，并表示“当以身力拒之”，坚定维护孙中山的领导地位。
description.en: Refused the request by Tao Cheng-chang and others to replace Sun Yat-sen as Premier, stating he would 'resist it with all my strength,' firmly upholding Sun's leadership.

description.zh-cn: 派遣人员刺杀了陶成章。
description.en: Dispatched personnel to assassinate Tao Cheng-chang.

description.zh-cn: 在陈其美的指派下，执行了对陶成章的刺杀。
description.en: Under the direction of Chen Qimei, carried out the assassination of Tao Cheng-chang.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴逝世时，蔡锷写下挽联悼念，两人同为革命元勋，并同葬于岳麓山。
description.en: When Huang Xing passed away, Cai E wrote a couplet in mourning. Both were founding fathers of the revolution and are buried together on Yuelu Mountain.

description.zh-cn: 章太炎很敬重黄兴，曾愿拥戴其为同盟会领袖，并在其追悼会上送挽联：“无公则无民国，有史必有斯人。”
description.en: Zhang Taiyan held great respect for Huang Xing, once wishing to support him as the leader of the Tongmenghui, and sent a couplet to his memorial service that read: 'Without you, there would be no Republic; as long as there is history, there will be this man.'
